         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, rule  or  regu-

    3  authorized to transfer to the general fund of such school district,  for

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2634

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to authorize the Bay Shore union free school district to transfer
certain monies from reserve funds to the general fund for the purpose of
real property tax reduction

PURPOSE:
To authorize the Bay Shore Union Free School District to transfer
surplus monies from certain reserve funds to the general fund for
purposes of reducing real property taxes.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 1 of the bill authorizes the Bay Shore Union Free School
District to transfer to its general fund surplus monies in any
reserve fund established by the school district for the sole purpose
of reducing real property taxes.

Section 2 of the bill provides for the effective date.

JUSTIFICATION:
The Bay Shore Union Free School District is facing very difficult
budget conditions and would like to use surplus monies in its reserve
accounts to reduce real property taxes for the district's property
owners. This bill would provide the school district with the
statutory authority to utilize any such reserves on hand.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009-2010: S.4427/A.80B7

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
To be determined.

LOCAL FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
